recipes.title: Bacon, Jalapeno, Red Onion and Cream Cheese Makes the Best Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz are my top picks for Pizza. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. One wine you could try is Cecchi Sangiovese di Toscana. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 9 dollars.

productMatches.title: Cecchi Sangiovese di Toscana
productMatches.description: The red wine is made according to traditional methods, along with the help of modern technology and with much care. It has a ruby red colour with purple lights, and a delicate fruity bouquet reminiscent of violets and irises. Its good structure, well combined with a moderate acidity, can be distinguished on the palate. Although lacking in sharp tannins, the generous taste of the Sangiovese guarantees a wine that ages well. This wine is pleasant with cold and hot meat dishes and when young should be served at a temperature of 16 Â°C.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.Work your pizza dough into a greased pan. Brush the surface of the pizza with the garlic olive oil.Scatter the shredded cheese all over.Scatter the red onion, jalapeno pepper and bacon on top of the cheese.Bake for 10 minutes and then remove from the oven.Dot the surface with the cream cheese balls and return the pizza to the oven.Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until crust is lightly brown.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.Work your pizza dough into a greased pan.
Brush the surface of the pizza with the garlic olive oil.Scatter the shredded cheese all over.Scatter the red onion, jalapeno pepper and bacon on top of the cheese.
Bake for 10 minutes and then remove from the oven.Dot the surface with the cream cheese balls and return the pizza to the oven.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until crust is lightly brown.
